datafield.subfield: Multiscale Modeling of Granular Assemblies Based on Different Micromechanical Strain

The micromechanical definition of strain tensor for granular assemblies has been investigated in many granular mechanics literature, yet reached no consensus. In multiscale modelingMultiscale modeling , micro strainStrain definitions affect the micro stress, making the macro response of granular assemblies vary as well. In this paper, we employ a multiscale modeling by coupling the FEM in macro-scale and the discrete element method (DEM) in micro-scale. A biaxial compression experiment is simulated using the multiscale approach. Cundall’s best-fit strain and Kruyt-Rothenburg strain are adopted to measure the average strain, and the corresponding macro responses are observed. Some interesting experimental observations, such as dilation, are also captured.
